TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit TemplateDefinition extends System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerObject

Docs.summary: Provides properties and methods that define a template element in a Web server control at design time.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The TemplateDefinition class provides a base template definition class that can be inherited from and extended for a control designer to use in providing support for templated controls in a design host such as [!INCLUDE[vsprvslong](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)]. A design host uses the properties and methods of the TemplateDefinition class to facilitate creating and editing a template at design time.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to derive a custom class from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner> class. This control designer supports a control with four possible templates.
To try it, add a reference to the System.Design.dll assembly, compile the code, and then, in a design host such as [!INCLUDE[vsprvslong](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)], look at the page in Design view. Select the control, click the action list to select a template to modify, and then use the drag-and-drop feature to move controls into the template.
[!code-cs[DesignerTemplateGroupSample#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.ui.design.t_2_1.cs)] [!code-vb[DesignerTemplateGroupSample#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.ui.design.t_2_1.vb)] [!code-vb[DesignerTemplateGroupSample#2](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.ui.design.t_2_2.aspx)]

The name of the template.

The property name that represents this template in the **Properties** list in the design host.

The name of the template.
The object that contains the template.
The property name that represents this template in the **Properties** list in the design host.
A Boolean value indicating whether the template content should allow only Web server controls.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, using the provided designer, template name, template, property name, and whether to limit the template contents to Web server controls.

MemberSignature.Value: public TemplateDefinition (System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner designer, string name, object templatedObject, string templatePropertyName, System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style style);

The name of the template.
The object that contains the template.
The property name that represents this template in the **Properties** list in the design host.
A object to apply to each template.

MemberSignature.Value: public TemplateDefinition (System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner designer, string name, object templatedObject, string templatePropertyName, System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style style, bool serverControlsOnly);

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner designer, string name, object templatedObject, string templatePropertyName, class System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style style, bool serverControlsOnly) cil managed

Docs.param: The parent object.
The name of the template.
The object that contains the template.
The property name that represents this template in the **Properties** list in the design host.
A object to apply to each template.
A Boolean value indicating whether the template should limit content to Web server controls.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, using the provided designer, template name, template, property name, object, and whether to limit content to Web server controls.
Gets a value that indicates whether the template should enable editing of its contents.
Docs.value: if editing is allowed; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks To change the default, derived classes must override the AllowEditing property.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual string Content { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the HTML markup representing the content of the template.
Docs.value: HTML markup for the content of the template.

Docs.summary: Retrieves a value indicating whether the template should limit content to Web server controls, as set in the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateDefinition.%23ctor%2A> constructor. This property is read-only.
Docs.value: if content is limited to Web server controls; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: Retrieves the style that should be applied to the template as set in the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateDefinition.%23ctor%2A> constructor. This property is read-only.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Although the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> property is read-only, the properties of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> can be set.

Docs.summary: Retrieves or sets a value indicating whether the template supports data binding.
Docs.value: if the template supports data binding; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: Retrieves the component in which the template resides. This property is read-only.
Docs.value: The component as set when this was created.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Although this TemplatedObject property is read-only, its properties can be set, and if <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateDefinition.AllowEditing%2A> is true, the content can be edited.

Docs.summary: Retrieves the property name for the template that the design host should display in the property grid.
Docs.value: The name of the template as it should appear in the **Properties** list of the design host.
